contentrichtext.text: '''Zacharie Mayani''' (1899 - ?)<ref>[http://www.hrc.utexas.edu/research/fa/knopf.corr3.html Mayani, Zecharia, 1899]</ref> was a [[French people|French]] [[writer]] and author of a number of books. ==Education== He was educated at [[Paris University]], where he received his doctorate. He was also a student in the [[École du Louvre]]. His book ''Les Etrusques commencent a parler'' (''The Etruscans Begin to Speak'')connects [[Etruscan language|Etruscan]] to [[Albanian language|Albanian]], a connection which most scholars dismiss as "wildly speculative".<ref>{{cite book | last = Temporini | first = Hildegard | authorlink = | coauthors = Haase, Wolfgang; Vogt, Joseph | editor = | others = | title = Aufstieg und Niedergang der römischen Welt: (ANRW) : Geschichte und Kultur Roms im Spiegel der neueren Forschung. Principat ; 37, Philosophie, Wissenschaften, Technik ; 1, Wissenschaften (Medizin und Biologie), Volume 2; Volume 31; Volume 37 | origdate = | origyear = | origmonth = | url = http://books.google.com/books?id=4iduFyo3Y0EC&pg=PA9&dq=%2BMayani+%2BAlbanian&as_brr=3#v=onepage&q=%2BMayani%20%2BAlbanian&f=false | format = | accessdate = 2011-03-18 | edition = | date = | year = 1993 | month = | publisher = [[Walter de Gruyter]] | location = | language = | id = | doi = | pages = 937 | chapter = | chapterurl = | quote = Hypotheses about the Etruscan language range from the wildly speculative (e.g. Z. MAYANI, Les Etrusques commencent a parler, Collections signes de temps, 11 [Paris, 1961], who argues for Albanian as the 'root' tongue) }} ISBN 3-11-013746-1. note 16. p. 9.</ref> He put forth a thesis that the [[Etruscan language]] had links to the [[Albanian language]] with exuberant reconstructions.<ref>On the Dot: The Speck That Changed the World by Alexander Humez and Nicholas Humez,2008,Back Matter: "... it. See, for example, the exuberant hypothetical recon- structions in Zacharie Mayani's The Etruscans Begin to Speak. 166 China: For an article ..."</ref> The Albanian régime of [[Enver Hoxha]] embraced this theory for [[propaganda]] reasons, and extended it to include the [[Pelasgians]] in this association. Mainstream scholars have paid Mayani's arguments little serious attention. He also<ref>A thousand plateaus: capitalism and schizophrenia Continuum Impacts by Gilles Deleuze, Félix Guattari,2004,ISBN-0826476945,page 583</ref> in ''Les Hyksos et le monde de la Bible'' (Paris:Payoy,1956) emphasized the connection between the [[Hebrews]] the [[Kenites]] and the [[Habiru]]. Zachari also supported that [[Canaan]]ites went into [[Asia Minor]], [[Illyria]], and even [[Italy]].<ref>[http://www.askelm.com/news/n081101.pdf Old Testament History, the Basics]</ref> ==Bibliography== *''L'arbre sacré et le rite de l'alliance chez les anciens sémites'' (1935)<ref>Mayani, Zacharie.
